intro: Gynema parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered gynema, is a shrub native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves. The plant is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Its medicinal properties have been studied for their potential health benefits. However, it is not widely cultivated and remains relatively obscure in botanical literature.
